Package nusri.fyp.demo.service.img_sender

Class ImageSenderService

java.lang.Object
nusri.fyp.demo.service.img_sender.ImageSenderService
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageSenderServiceImplOfPython, ImageSenderServiceImplOfRoboflow
@Service public abstract class ImageSenderService extends Object
Abstract service for sending image or video frames to a model for recognition tasks.

This class defines shared functionality for reading video files, extracting frames, and delegating the actual recognition to specific implementations via its abstract methods. The recognized output is captured as AbstractActionObservation objects.


  • Video Frame Extraction: This class uses OpenCV's VideoCapture to read video files and split them into frames.
  • Frame Skipping: The number of frames to skip is determined by ConfigService. This helps manage performance by not processing every single frame if unnecessary.
  • Asynchronous Processing: Each frame can be sent asynchronously (implementation-defined in sendFrameAsync(Mat, String, Map)) to allow concurrent recognition tasks.

The resulting maps and data structures are stored in concurrency-friendly collections like ConcurrentHashMap to handle parallel processing without locking complexities.

See Also:
  • ConfigService
  • AbstractActionObservation
  • StateMachine
  • sendVideoFile(File, String, Map)

  • Field Details

    • tempFiles

      public final Map<String,File> tempFiles
      A mapping from user identifier to their temporary uploaded File reference.
      This is commonly used to store a user's uploaded video file before processing.

    • totleFramesMap

      public final Map<String,Long> totleFramesMap
      A mapping from user identifier to the total number of frames (after skipping) in the uploaded video.
      Used to track progress in recognition tasks.

    • progressMap

      public final Map<String,Map<Long,List<? extends AbstractActionObservation>>> progressMap
      Tracks the recognition results (inference outcomes) by user.
      The outer map key is the user identifier.
      The inner map key is the frame timestamp (in milliseconds).
      The inner map value is a list of AbstractActionObservation for that frame.

    • sendingProcesses

      public final Map<String,List<CompletableFuture<List<AbstractActionObservation>>>> sendingProcesses
      A mapping from user identifier to a list of CompletableFuture tasks representing in-flight recognition processes.
      Useful for potential interruption or cancellation of ongoing tasks.

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageSenderService

      public ImageSenderService(ConfigService configService)
      Constructor that injects the config service.
      The config service is used for retrieving settings like the frame interval or video path.
      Parameters:
      configService - the configuration service object
      See Also:
      • ConfigService

  • Method Details

    • sendFrame

      public abstract List<? extends AbstractActionObservation> sendFrame(org.opencv.core.Mat frame, Map<String,String> config) throws IOException
      Synchronously sends an image frame (OpenCV Mat) to the model for recognition.
      Implementations are expected to convert the frame as needed (e.g., to a PNG byte array or a Base64 string).
      Parameters:
      frame - the OpenCV Mat object representing a single image frame
      config - a Map of relevant configurations (e.g., host, port, or other settings)
      Returns:
      a list of AbstractActionObservation instances representing the recognized actions/objects
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O problem occurs during sending

    • sendFrame

      public abstract List<? extends AbstractActionObservation> sendFrame(String frame, Map<String,String> config)
      Synchronously sends a Base64-encoded image string to the model for recognition.
      Useful for scenarios where frames are captured or stored in Base64.
      Parameters:
      frame - a Base64-encoded image string
      config - a Map of relevant configurations
      Returns:
      a list of AbstractActionObservation instances for the recognized actions/objects

    • sendFrameAsync

      public abstract CompletableFuture<List<AbstractActionObservation>> sendFrameAsync(org.opencv.core.Mat frame, String user, Map<String,String> config)
      Sends an image frame (OpenCV Mat) to the model asynchronously for recognition.
      Returns a CompletableFuture that completes when the recognition result is available.
      Parameters:
      frame - the OpenCV Mat representing a single image frame
      user - the user identifier (to track or cancel ongoing tasks)
      config - a Map of relevant configurations
      Returns:
      a CompletableFuture containing a list of AbstractActionObservation

    • interrupt

      public abstract void interrupt(String user)
      Interrupts (cancels) the ongoing recognition process for the specified user, if any.
      Typically cancels any pending or running CompletableFuture tasks in sendingProcesses.
      Parameters:
      user - the user identifier

    • sendVideoFile

      public Map<Long,List<? extends AbstractActionObservation>> sendVideoFile(File file, String user, Map<String,String> config) throws IOException
      Reads a video file from disk and sends each frame to the model for recognition.
      This process uses:
      • OpenCV's VideoCapture to read frames from the file.
      • The frame-skip interval from ConfigService to potentially skip frames.
      • An asynchronous sending mechanism: see sendFrameAsync(Mat, String, Map) for details on how frames are actually recognized.
      Parameters:
      file - the video File to process
      user - the user identifier (used for tracking progress and for cancellations)
      config - additional configuration parameters (e.g., host and port for the recognition service)
      Returns:
      a Map where each key is the frame timestamp (in ms), and each value is a list of recognition results
      Throws:
      IOException - if the video file cannot be opened or an error occurs in reading frames
      See Also:
      • VideoCapture
      • Videoio.CAP_PROP_FRAME_COUNT
      • Videoio.CAP_PROP_FPS

    • processImg

      public void processImg(String img, String timestamp, StateMachine stateMachine, Map<String,String> config)
      Processes a single Base64-encoded image and updates the StateMachine's observations accordingly.
      It:
      1. Sends the image synchronously via sendFrame(String, Map).
      2. Adds the resulting observations to the state machine's observation map.
      3. Invokes StateMachine.updateStateProbability(List, double, ConfigService) to update probabilities.
      Parameters:
      img - a Base64-encoded image
      timestamp - the timestamp or frame index (string) for identification
      stateMachine - the target state machine to update
      config - additional configuration parameters for the sending logic
      See Also:
      • StateMachine
      • sendFrame(String, Map)
